task: Give 12 lbs of 4-cyanoindole, converted to molar and indicate the percentage of C, H, N.

task: Give 12 lbs of 4-cyanoindole, converted to molar and indicate the percentage of C, H, N.
observation:
This summary reflects only the latest observations:

The user's task was to convert 12 lbs of 4-cyanoindole into moles and determine the percentage composition of carbon (C), hydrogen (H), and nitrogen (N). The user accessed Wolfram Alpha and entered queries to achieve this goal. The first query resulted in finding that 12 pounds of 4-cyanoindole equates to 38.288 moles.

Subsequently, the user adjusted the search query and successfully obtained the mass percentages of the elements in 4-cyanoindole: Carbon (C) at 76.04%, Hydrogen (H) at 4.254%, and Nitrogen (N) at 19.71%. The molecular formula, C9H6N2, was also confirmed.

For full context and details regarding the task's progress, the complete task history should be referred to.
